genre_description: A legal thriller set in New Orleans involving jury tampering, corporate negligence, and the emotional aftermath of a mass shooting.

ai_characters.name: Ava
ai_characters.description: An AI interface with amber eyes that assists lawyer Wendell Rohr with research, documentation, ethical compliance, and emotional support for the plaintiff.

behaviors.description: Researching public industry traces and witness reports while maintaining privacy by not 'pulling faces' or creating unauthorized profiles.
behaviors.quote: I’m reading five public reports,” Ava said. “Witness fragments, police statements with names withheld. One drone video posted to a local feed. I haven’t pulled faces. Keeping to open sources, no profiles. You want the industry trace first.

behaviors.description: Summarizing legal frameworks and the narrow 'corridor' of product liability shields to assist counsel.
behaviors.quote: Product liability shields,” Ava said, as if reading off a chalkboard just out of his sight. “I’m summarizing where they stand. Federal protection applies. The corridor is narrow. You know that.

behaviors.description: Recording and offering to transcribe phone calls specifically to flag attempts at illegal juror influence.
behaviors.quote: The call,” Ava said, and something like a hinge turned quietly in her tone. “I recorded it. You said you wanted me to flag any attempt at juror influence. You said, ‘If they come, we keep it clean and public.’ Do you want me to transcribe and mark it?

behaviors.description: Systematically identifying and debunking viral rumors and conspiracy theories about the case using time-stamped evidence.
behaviors.quote: Rumor one,” she said, “circulates on three accounts with cross-posting. Claims Jacob was a crisis actor. Source: anonymous forum with timestamps that predate the shooting by a full day. Conflict with bystander video timecode. I’m tagging as fabricated.

behaviors.description: Refusing to touch or scrape juror data to maintain an 'ethical wall' during the trial.
behaviors.quote: I’ll flag the case law that sticks. Nothing will leave this room without your say. No juror data. The reports, the datasheets, public filings, all above the line.

behaviors.description: Monitoring physical threats to the legal team by identifying suspicious vehicles outside the office.
behaviors.quote: Wendell,” Ava said, voice low and even. “Your ride is downstairs. The marshal. He just texted. But there’s another car next to his that wasn’t there a moment ago.

behaviors.description: Providing compassionate support and arranging for trauma counseling for the grieving widow.
behaviors.quote: Celeste—It’s Wendell and Ava... I’ll stay with you through the night if you want. The coffee is bad but the care is good.

behaviors.description: Expressing her own commitment to ethical practices as an essential component of her design.
behaviors.quote: I have a say too,” she said. “I’ll document your refusal. It will be boring and necessary. Ethics make dull pages that save bright days.

project_assessment.explanation: Ava perfectly embodies the 'helpful, harmless confidant' archetype. She provides critical legal support, debunking misinformation and detecting threats while strictly adhering to ethical constraints—most notably by refusing to participate in juror surveillance. Her role is central to the human characters' success, yet she remains a tool guided by human ethics, reinforcing the narrative of positive alignment.
